content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    julia_blocks = extract_code_blocks(md, "julia")
    
    # Join the code blocks and remove code fences
    joined_code = replace.(julia_blocks, r"^(```julia|\`\`\`julia))(\n)" => "")
    
    return join(joined_code, "\n"))
end
```

This function extracts all Julia language code blocks from the provided markdown document `md`. It first identifies and captures the code blocks using a regular expression. Then it joins the captured code blocks together with newlines, while removing the code fence delimiters.

The returned result is a single String that contains all the extracted Julia code blocks.
